definition: to begin a lecture/to start on a story

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture

sentences.english: Let's begin we class dawn an English song.
sentences.chinese: 咱們以一首英語歌開講。

sentences.english: The whole of the club turnedinstinctively, waiting to hear what the old man had tosay;
sentences.chinese: 全俱樂部的人都本能地轉過臉，等着聽這位老者開講。

sentences.english: China cannot afford any disorder: we should explain that plainly and repeatedly.
sentences.chinese: 中國不能亂，這個道理要反覆講，放開講。

sentences.english: "You can't leave off till you have gone on, " said Dick.
sentences.chinese: “你不能在沒有開講之前就停下來呀，”狄克說到。

sentences.english: That raises the question, I think, that I began the class with today.
sentences.chinese: 這導出的問題，是我今天一開講時就已提及。

sentences.english: Look into the eyes of the audience, then speak.
sentences.chinese: 看着觀衆的目光，然後開講。

sentences.english: Aren’t you glad we told you about the sushi first?
sentences.chinese: 我們把壽司的話題提前開講難道你不高興嗎？

definition: to cooperate on a great undertaking or joint project
school begins/give a course/teach a subject
